| A prison guard:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is [herbivorous](/wiki/Herbivore "Herbivore").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").
* is a member of the Yendorian army.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                     |

The **Prison guard** is a non-unique but non-randomly-generated [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") added in the [Convict patch](/wiki/Convict "Convict"). Prison guards are generated only in [the quest](/wiki/Convict_quest "Convict quest"), as a challenge to the Convict seeking the [Iron Ball of Liberation](/wiki/Iron_Ball_of_Liberation "Iron Ball of Liberation").

When a prison guard confronts the [player](/wiki/Player "Player"), it will demand a [bribe](/wiki/Bribe "Bribe") ("The prison guard demands \<bribe amount> to avoid re-arrest"). The expected bribe is the player's [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") \* 500 [zorkmids](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid").

If the bribe is paid, the guard will become peaceful (but not courteous—"Good. Now beat it, scum!") and leave the player alone.

Like the [Minetown watch](/wiki/Watchman "Watchman") and [vault guards](/wiki/Vault_guard "Vault guard"), prison guards are coded as [mercenaries](/wiki/Mercenaries "Mercenaries") and outfitted as such. The prison guard's target AC is -2, the same as for a Yendorian [lieutenant](/wiki/Lieutenant "Lieutenant"). Like [watch captains](/wiki/Watch_captain "Watch captain"), prison guards have a 50% chance of being generated with a [silver saber](/wiki/Silver_saber "Silver saber") instead of a [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword").

## References

Reference: [Karl Garrison's Convict Patch](http://nethack.edeca.net/karl/nethack-convict-0.7.diff)
html:
Prison guard

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ prison guard
Difficulty 14
Attacks Weapon 4d4 physical, Weapon 4d4 physical
@ prison guard
Difficulty 14
Attacks

Weapon 4d4 physical, Weapon 4d4 physical

Base level 12
Base experience 277
Speed 10
Base AC 10
Base MR 15
Alignment -6 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size medium

A prison guard:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is herbivorous.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is a member of the Yendorian army.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.

The Prison guard is a non-unique but non-randomly-generated monster added in the Convict patch. Prison guards are generated only in the quest, as a challenge to the Convict seeking the Iron Ball of Liberation.

When a prison guard confronts the player, it will demand a bribe ("The prison guard demands <bribe amount> to avoid re-arrest"). The expected bribe is the player's experience level * 500 zorkmids.

If the bribe is paid, the guard will become peaceful (but not courteous—"Good. Now beat it, scum!") and leave the player alone.

Like the Minetown watch and vault guards, prison guards are coded as mercenaries and outfitted as such. The prison guard's target AC is -2, the same as for a Yendorian lieutenant. Like watch captains, prison guards have a 50% chance of being generated with a silver saber instead of a long sword.

References

Reference: Karl Garrison's Convict Patch

The '''Prison guard''' is a non-unique but non-randomly-generated [[monster]] added in the [[Convict|Convict patch]]. Prison guards are generated only in [[Convict quest|the quest]], as a challenge to the Convict seeking the [[Iron Ball of Liberation]].

When a prison guard confronts the [[player]], it will demand a [[bribe]] ("The prison guard demands <bribe amount> to avoid re-arrest"). The expected bribe is the player's [[experience level]] * 500 [[zorkmid]]s. 

If the bribe is paid, the guard will become peaceful (but not courteous—"Good. Now beat it, scum!") and leave the player alone.

Like the [[watchman|Minetown watch]] and [[vault guard]]s, prison guards are coded as [[mercenaries]] and outfitted as such. The prison guard's target AC is -2, the same as for a Yendorian [[lieutenant]]. Like [[watch captain]]s, prison guards have a 50% chance of being generated with a [[silver saber]] instead of a [[long sword]].

==References==
Reference: [http://nethack.edeca.net/karl/nethack-convict-0.7.diff Karl Garrison's Convict Patch]
